item.title: Shree Rama Newsprint Q2 FY26: Mounting Losses Deepen as Revenue Plunges 24%
item.description: Shree Rama Newsprint Ltd., India's largest private sector newsprint manufacturer, reported alarming financial results for Q2 FY26, with net losses widening to ₹7.95 crores despite marginal sequential improvement. The company's revenue collapsed 24.11% year-on-year to ₹6.83 crores, whilst operating margins excluding other income plummeted to a mere 3.22%, signalling severe operational distress in India's beleaguered newsprint sector. Time: 39 minutes ago

item.title: Atul Auto Q2 FY26: Strong Quarter Masks Underlying Structural Concerns
item.description: Atul Auto Ltd., the Gujarat-based three-wheeler commercial vehicle manufacturer, reported a robust second quarter for FY2026, with consolidated net profit surging 210.85% quarter-on-quarter to ₹9.17 crores. The impressive sequential recovery, however, masks deeper structural challenges that continue to weigh on the company's long-term investment appeal. Despite the strong quarterly showing, the stock has declined 17.54% over the past year, significantly underperforming the Sensex's 7.07% gain and the automobile sector's 25.74% advance. Time: 39 minutes ago

item.title: Surana Telecom Q2 FY26: Sharp Profit Decline Amid Revenue Surge Raises Sustainability Concerns
item.description: Surana Telecom and Power Ltd. reported a troubling quarter in Q2 FY26, with consolidated net profit plunging 71.64% sequentially to ₹0.76 crores despite a massive 126.33% surge in revenue. The micro-cap power sector company, with a market capitalisation of ₹242.00 crores, saw its shares trading at ₹17.52, down 40.25% from its 52-week high of ₹29.32, reflecting investor scepticism about earnings quality and operational sustainability. Time: 39 minutes ago

item.title: Confidence Petroleum India Ltd Drops 3.73% Amid Mixed Signals and Volatility
item.description: Confidence Petroleum India Ltd’s shares declined by 3.73% over the week ending 6 February 2026, closing at Rs.31.26 from Rs.32.47 the previous Friday. This underperformance contrasted with the Sensex’s 1.51% gain during the same period, reflecting a challenging week marked by a fresh 52-week low and a sharp gap up rally that failed to sustain momentum. Time: 47 minutes ago

item.title: Indian Metals & Ferro Alloys Ltd Gains 14.01%: 5 Key Factors Driving the Weekly Surge
item.description: Indian Metals & Ferro Alloys Ltd delivered a strong weekly performance, rising 14.01% from Rs.1,166.05 to Rs.1,329.45 between 2 and 6 February 2026, significantly outperforming the Sensex’s 1.51% gain over the same period. The stock’s rally was supported by a series of positive technical upgrades, robust quarterly results, and renewed investor interest amid a recovering ferrous metals sector, despite some short-term margin volatility and valuation concerns. Time: 47 minutes ago

item.title: Bharat Forge Gains 8.04%: 5 Key Factors Driving the Week’s Momentum
item.description: Bharat Forge Ltd delivered a strong performance in the week ending 6 February 2026, rising 8.04% from Rs.1,440.75 to Rs.1,556.55, significantly outperforming the Sensex’s 1.51% gain over the same period. The stock hit multiple new 52-week highs, driven by robust financial results, technical momentum, and increased market interest, despite some profit booking towards the week’s close. item.title: Goodyear India Ltd Gains 7.16%: 4 Key Factors Driving the Week’s Rally
item.description: Goodyear India Ltd’s shares rebounded strongly this week, gaining 7.16% from Rs.787.30 to Rs.843.70, significantly outperforming the Sensex’s 1.51% rise over the same period. The stock’s volatile journey included a fresh 52-week low early in the week, followed by a robust rally capped by a 10.59% intraday surge on Friday, reflecting a mix of financial results, technical shifts, and market sentiment that shaped investor behaviour. Time: 47 minutes ago

item.title: Sarda Energy & Minerals Gains 8.08%: 2 Key Factors Driving the Weekly Rally

item.title: Firstsource Solutions Ltd Falls 9.11%: Earnings and Valuation Shift Shape the Week
item.description: Firstsource Solutions Ltd experienced a challenging week on the BSE, closing at Rs.290.25 on 6 February 2026, down 9.11% from the previous Friday’s close of Rs.319.35. This decline contrasted with the Sensex’s 1.51% gain over the same period, highlighting the stock’s underperformance amid mixed corporate news and valuation adjustments. Key events including the Q3 FY26 earnings release and a valuation reassessment influenced investor sentiment and price action throughout the week. Time: 48 minutes ago

item.title: Skipper Ltd Gains 7.00%: 3 Key Factors Driving the Weekly Move
item.description: Skipper Ltd delivered a strong weekly performance, rising 7.00% from Rs.361.20 to Rs.386.50 between 2 and 6 February 2026, comfortably outperforming the Sensex’s 1.51% gain over the same period. The week was marked by a significant intraday surge and a notable gap up on 3 February, followed by a mixed technical and fundamental backdrop culminating in a rating downgrade by MarketsMOJO. This review analyses the key events shaping the stock’s price action and market sentiment during the week. Time: 48 minutes ago

item.title: Sterlite Technologies Ltd Gains 24.60%: 5 Key Factors Driving the Surge
item.description: Sterlite Technologies Ltd delivered a remarkable weekly performance, surging 24.60% from Rs.106.30 to Rs.132.45 between 2 and 6 February 2026, significantly outperforming the Sensex’s modest 1.51% gain over the same period. The stock exhibited strong intraday volatility, marked by a sharp intraday low on 2 February followed by a robust gap-up and sustained rally on 3 February. Despite a slight pullback on the final trading day, Sterlite Technologies maintained a commanding lead over the benchmark index, reflecting a week of intense market activity and shifting technical momentum. Time: 48 minutes ago

item.title: J Kumar Infraprojects Ltd’s Volatile Week: 0.09% Gain Amid Bearish Technical Signals
item.description: J Kumar Infraprojects Ltd closed the week with a marginal gain of 0.09%, ending at Rs.570.00 on 6 February 2026, despite a turbulent trading week marked by sharp intraday swings and a pronounced bearish technical outlook. While the Sensex advanced 1.51% over the same period, the stock’s price action reflected mixed momentum signals, a significant 52-week low breach, and a downgrade to a Sell rating, underscoring ongoing challenges amid sector headwinds. item.title: Gujarat Terce Laboratories Falls 3.80%: Margin Pressures and Flat Quarterly Results Weigh
item.description: Gujarat Terce Laboratories Ltd experienced a challenging week on the bourses, with its stock price declining by 3.80% from ₹46.00 to ₹44.25, underperforming the Sensex which rose 1.51% over the same period. The week was marked by disappointing quarterly results and margin pressures that weighed heavily on investor sentiment, despite some intraday recoveries. The stock’s volatility was accentuated by a sharp 5.40% drop on 5 February following the release of flat quarterly performance data, signalling operational headwinds amid a competitive pharmaceutical sector environment. Time: 48 minutes ago

item.title: Goyal Associates Ltd Falls 14.14%: 3 Key Factors Driving the Weekly Decline
